content.description: Thoughtful slab climbing past the first few bolts leads up to a roof crux. Move left under the roof to reach a jug out left and then pull up past the roof. Very fun route! Shares anchor with the sport route to the left.
content.location: Look for the slab of white granite below the roof. Right side of north face.

content.description: To the right of the 5.6 slab is its sibling slightly more featured route.
content.protection: Bolts to shared anchor of 5.6 to left
content.location: Also near the north aspect's left side.

content.description: Ascend low angle slab and dishes through good clean rock and no distinct crux to rap chains at summit with decent views.  Fun beginner climb.
content.protection: 7 Bolts to bolted rap link anchor.
content.location: Far left side of north face.

content.description:
Climbing up Prominent dihedral.

A giant juggy flake feature marks the start of the route.  Several options through the flake are possible but the crack offers the best protection.  Ascend to the highly protected corner; the face to the right of the corner is featured and eliminates the necessity for pure jamming.  Above the corner, clip a bolt on the slab on the way to the anchor.
content.protection: Gear, a pro bolt high up, and two bolt anchor with rap quicklinks.
content.location: This prominent right-facing dihedral with excellent rock quality marks the right corner of the north face.

climbs.name: Northern Exposure
climbs.fa: Jim Voss, Reed Ames, Ngoc Nguyen

content.description: Fun climbing up the left arete of the north face. Great views and exposure make this a classic route for the grade.
content.location: Starts on the far left side of the North face. Begin climbing up the arete at the 4th bolt.

content.description: Move up a scoop past the 1st bolt. 2nd bolt is hard to see while you are on the route, but it is straight above and inside a small hueco. Fun moves up higher pulling on to the face.
content.location: Slightly left of center on the north face.

content.description: Steep start past the 1st bolt leads to slabbier blimbing up high. Shares the anchor with the route to the left, "Little Chief".
content.location: In the middle of the north face. Steep start.

content.description: Bouldery start leads to fun climbing up high past a few bulges. Shares anchor with "War Path".
content.location: Slightly right of the center of the north face.
